intro: Lepidagathis thymifolia, commonly known as the lemon-scented thyme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small leaves that emit a citrus-like fragrance. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant foliage and delicate floral display.
